definition: to campaign for votes/to ask voters for support
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: I saw her father with his rosette on, canvassing for the Conservatives.
sentences.chinese: 我看見她父親戴着玫瑰花結，正在爲保守黨遊說拉票。

sentences.english: If only. The ensuing election was rife with examples of voter fraud and ballot-stuffing.
sentences.chinese: 大選中充滿着欺詐行爲和惡意拉票現象。

sentences.english: Audit is true there are votes on the act, must be dealt with severely.
sentences.chinese: 對查覈屬實有拉票行爲的人員，要予以嚴肅處理。

sentences.english: Candidates brandished their copies at campaign events.
sentences.chinese: 候選人揮舞着它的副本爲自己拉票。

sentences.english: Thank you to flow at all tearful , you thank him for canvassing.
sentences.chinese: 謝謝他不惜一切地流下淚來，謝謝他給你拉票。

sentences.english: Canvassing is considered to be bad form and is therefore counter—productive.
sentences.chinese: 遊說拉票被認爲是不好的形式，只會適得其反。

sentences.english: He canvasses by singing, and the votes have really increased a lot.
sentences.chinese: 他唱歌爲自己拉票，票數還真是增長了不少呢。

sentences.english: Telon very happy because the Siamese development campaign now ranked first.
sentences.chinese: 塔隆很高興因爲暹羅發展黨現在拉票排在第一。

definition: to assist in a candidate's election campaign (Tw)
to take part in an election/to run for office
(slang) to cheer sb on/to show one's support/("call" is pronounced approximately like English "call")
to vote against the party line/to vote contrary to one's promise
to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
